programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: This Week With George Stephanopoulos
programme.desc: Former Clinton White House staffer and current co-anchor of ABC's weekday morning news show "Good Morning America," George Stephanopoulos and co-anchors Martha Raddatz and Jonathan Karl offer a look at current events with a focus on the politics of the day. Each week's show includes interviews with top newsmakers (including some of the nation's top political leaders) as well as a roundtable discussion, usually featuring journalists from ABC and other news organizations, of the week's happenings. Since 2008, the program has broadcast from a studio at the Newseum in Washington, D.C.

programme.title: The CUT
programme.desc: J.T. Poston wins the 2024 Shriners Children's Open and captures his third PGA TOUR victory. Rickie Fowler plays pickleball with Shriners Ambassador Grayson, who was born without a femur and two fingers on his left hand. Taylor Montgomery talks about his 2024 season and overcoming injury. Look ahead to the ZOZO CHAMPIONSHIP where Collin Morikawa will look to defend his title, all on this week's episode of The CUT.

programme.title: 2024 ZOZO Championship
programme.desc: Nico Echavarria captures his second victory on the PGA TOUR after winning the 2024 ZOZO CHAMPIONSHIP. Echavarria shot rounds of 64-64-65-67 to finish 20-under.

programme.title: 2024 ZOZO Championship
programme.desc: Nico Echavarria captures his second victory on the PGA TOUR after winning the 2024 ZOZO CHAMPIONSHIP. Echavarria shot rounds of 64-64-65-67 to finish 20-under.

programme.title: Shriners Children's Open
programme.desc: J.T. Poston holds off Doug Ghim to win the 2024 Shriners Children's Open for his third PGA TOUR title.

programme.title: 2024 Black Desert Championship
programme.desc: PGA TOUR Rookie Matt McCarty wins the inaugural 2024 Black Desert Championship. McCarty was competing in just his second PGA TOUR event after receiving a promotion for winning three times on the Korn Ferry Tour this season.

programme.title: 2024 Sanderson Farms Championship
programme.desc: Kevin Yu outlasts Beau Hossler in a one-hole playoff to win the 2024 Sanderson Farms Championship. This is Yu's first career victory on the PGA TOUR.

programme.title: United States Team Wins 2024 Presidents Cup
programme.desc: The United States Team defeated the International Team in the 2024 Presidents Cup, with a final score of 18.5-11.5, in the 10th consecutive Presidents Cup victory for the United States.

programme.title: Patton Kizzire wins Procore Championship
programme.desc: Patton Kizzire claims his third PGA TOUR title after winning the 2024 Procore Championship. Kizzire shot rounds of 66-65-67-70 to finish 20-under.

programme.title: 2024 TOUR Championship
programme.desc: Scottie Scheffler captures the FedExCup trophy with his win at the 2024 TOUR Championship. This is Scheffler's seventh PGA TOUR victory of the season and 13th career win.

programme.title: PGA Tour

programme.title: World Series Film

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1981 matchup between the Dodgers and the Yankees. New York took a 2-0 series lead, but Los Angeles battled back behind strong pitching and a deep lineup to secure the World Series championship.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: This World Series Film showcases the 1986 matchup between the Mets and the Red Sox. A famous error in the 10th inning of Game 6 from Boston's Bill Buckner helped New York rally from a 3-2 series deficit and take home the World Series championship.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: The first World Series to be played in an indoor ballpark, the Twins used their familiarity with the Metrodome to their advantage to capture their first World Series Championship since moving to Minnesota.

programme.title: Iron Resurrection
programme.desc: A longtime customer has his eye set on a car from Joe's personal collection, a 1967 Nova; Joe counters by offering up a 1966 Nova, with the guarantee that it will be twice the car Joe's is; big brakes, big power, big wheels and more.

programme.title: Texas Metal
programme.desc: The guys bring a 1964 Lincoln back with a late-model Coyote engine and handmade interior; the Sling-Ray is a custom automotive sensation, but Ekstensive has what it's been missing.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kev take the show to the Midwest, as more than 2,500 cars descend on the Summit Motorsports drag strip for a weekend of fun; Kev gets a ride in a lean, mean drag racing machine; Dave steps up his autocross game.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The guys attempt to check off the final five states Freiburger needs to hit all 50 by taking their junkyard T-37 across New England; the T-37 hits the road, and the road hits back before the guys leave their mark in New York City.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich troubleshoot transmission issues and more in the 1969 Chevy Impala that's powered by a supercharged 498ci big-block V8, then take it back to the track to see if they can finally get their 10-second time slip.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The guys transform a '73 Opel funny car into a dirt-roosting machine.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike generate epic amounts of tire smoke as they try out 2015 supercars, the 707-horsepower Dodge Challenger SRT Hellcat and Charger SRT Hellcat, plus a 645-horsepower Dodge Viper GT.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: It's a project-car mishmash this time on Roadkill, powered by Dodge. It starts out Roadkill enough, with Finnegan surprising Freiburger with a '50 Ford 2-ton truck that the guys thrash to shorten up into a bobber rat rod.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Things do not go as planned when Finnegan and Freiburger swap the engines from an old Rogers Bonneville jet boat and a lowered '74 Chevy C10 pickup powered by a Chevrolet Performance LS6 crate engine.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: A 1980 Chevrolet Monte Carlo lowrider with hydraulics and Super Swamper off-road tires becomes the perfect vehicle for a desert trip to Las Vegas.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich begin piecing the General Mayhem '68 Charger back together, and they go through the process of getting the car back to its 440 big-block-powered version.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: The General Mayhem 1968 Dodge Charger is back together and better than ever, with its 440 big-block powerplant and rust-free sheet metal.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich hit the road in a '66 Chevy Chevelle purchased sight unseen in an attempt to score two new project cars. The guys fix and tune their way from Washington to Arizona to rescue a dirt-cheap junkyard '75 Dodge Dart.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The dream of long travel suspension on Roadkill's slightly modified Vette Kart finally comes true for the guys; Brad DeBerti helps them figure out how to not taco the front end as they take on a Pro2 truck on an off-road short course.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Newbern give new life to a '57 Chevy Bel Air that was pulled from a junkyard after more than 30 years. The guys drop in a small-block V8 and turbo 350 to get the car back on the pavement for a bumpy road trip back to where it came from.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Dulcich enlists Wiley Stevens and Chris Birdsong to transplant a third-generation Hemi into the 1974 Dodge D100, also known as the Mopar Muscle Truck; after issues hold up progress, the guys clean up a new project 1974 Dodge Charger.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The guys put John Andrade Jr. in a tiny truck and beat him in a mud drag race with the Dirt Track Camaro; Andrade challenges them to see what they can do with a derelict and parted-out Mustang against his 79 Chevy Malibu.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Tony Angelo take a terrible '68 to a whole new turbo-popping, flame-spewing, tire-shrieking level.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich finish the 1970 Plymouth that has languished away on the farm for so long; they transformed it from junk into one of the nicest piles in the Roadkill fleet, and undoubtedly one of the best at brutal burnouts for distance.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: A '67 Cougar powered by a Windsor-based 360ci stroker and backed by a four-speed is back; Freiburger and Dulcich try to fix a multitude of issues and get it back on the road.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Cotten challenges Finnegan and Newbern to some front-wheel-drive, high-school-antics-style racing; the guys hop up three cheap import beaters, build metal skids to replace the rear wheels, and have the wildest race to date.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Freiburger and Finnegan visit the infamous sinkhole that opened up inside the National Corvette Museum in Bowling Green, Ky.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: A 1974 Chevy Muscle Truck becomes a true dual-sport ride for surf and turf, shedding its drag slicks for Super Swamper Boggers and hitting the sand dunes.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Nearly two years after adding a Hemi engine to a 1955 Chevrolet Bel Air, the guys finally get the Mopar-powered Tri-Five on the road, but not without a few problems along the way.

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: The episode features 2,600 miles, 530 cubic inches, 700 horsepower, six speeds, 17 mpg, and two fun visits with friends Justin "Big Chief" Shearer and Shawn "Murder Nova" Ellington from "Street Outlaws."

programme.title: Roadkill

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: David and Mike head from the NHRA U.S. Nationals to Hot Rod Drag Week in a 1967 Ford Country Sedan station wagon.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Steve Dulcich enlists the help of crew member and fellow '80s action-movie enthusiast Wiley Stevens to get the '67 Bang Shifting Cougar back on the road; the guys install a new trans, suspension and custom hood, among other upgrades.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: Freiburger and Dulcich take the freshly painted and finished Crop Duster with its new 440 V8 to the track, before overcoming myriad issues and setbacks to finally achieve their elusive 10-second time slip.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan

programme.title: Roadkill

programme.title: Roadkill Garage

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan

programme.title: Roadkill
programme.desc: Finnegan and Tony Angelo take a terrible '68 to a whole new turbo-popping, flame-spewing, tire-shrieking level.

programme.title: Roadkill Garage

programme.title: Roadkill Garage
programme.desc: A '67 Cougar powered by a Windsor-based 360ci stroker and backed by a four-speed is back; Freiburger and Dulcich try to fix a multitude of issues and get it back on the road.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan

programme.title: Roadkill

programme.title: The Nightcap

Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. programme.title: Station West
programme.desc: In 1881, former Army Lt. John Haven (Dick Powell) acts as a secret government agent on a covert mission to investigate the theft of numerous gold shipments. Haven confides his mission to Capt. George Ilse (Tom Powers), who is doubtful over the shifty Haven's intent. Haven agrees to report his results to reliable gold mine owner Mary Caslon (Agnes Moorehead), then searches for the town's financier, Charlie (Jane Greer), whose nefarious dealings immediately bring her under suspicion.

programme.desc: A murderous sheep herder has taken Adam hostage to try and force Ben to sign over a large section of Ponderosa land to him.

programme.desc: As is often the case on Bonanza, things are not always as they first seem. Hoss and Adam eventually learn who is the good guy and who is not.

programme.title: Bonanza
programme.desc: When an inspector comes from New Orleans to arrest Ben Cartwright for a 20-year-old murder, Ben must withdraw from the Governor's race.

programme.desc: Unexpected trouble comes to a rancher who hires ex-convict Steve Bailey.

programme.desc: Della envies Annie's freedom and trick riding skills. When the rodeo comes to town, Della's father refuses to allow her to meet her boyfriend, one of the best competitors.

programme.desc: When a Mexican rancher accuses an innocent man of murder, Hoppy uses a black sombrero to clear the frame-up victim and save a wealthy young heiress.

programme.desc: Hoppy and Red are trapped in a burning house by a lovely young woman who has robbed a bank while posing as an old lady.

programme.desc: Lucas and Mark attempt to reform a con-man.

programme.desc: Gene, Pat, and a parson rid the town of Scorpion of a gambling ring and crooked politicians.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: To save the new school, Gene bets the ranch on a chariot race.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: A hardheaded businesswoman finds that efficiency is not the only thing to consider when running the ranch where Gene is foreman.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene aids two women who are victims of a mail-order marriage racket.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: In a plot to uncover a counterfeiting ring, Gene and Pat pretend to be bitter enemies.

programme.title: Storm Over Wyoming
programme.desc: A cowboy (Tim Holt) and his Irish-Mexican sidekick (Richard Martin) join a war over sheep and cattle.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene hires a parolee to give him a second chance, but the man turns out be his own worst enemy.

programme.title: Harry Tracy
programme.desc: Famed outlaw Harry Tracy (Bruce Dern) is known for his daring train robberies, but lately he's concentrating more on matters of the heart. That's why he's traveling to Oregon to reunite with his sweetheart, Catherine Tuttle (Helen Shaver). She's the daughter of a judge, and it's no surprise that, when Tracy gets to Portland, he winds up behind bars. But no jail built can hold the desperado, and, after breaking out, Tracy finds himself on the run from every lawman in the state.

programme.title: The Shooting
programme.desc: A woman recruits two cowboys to help her seek revenge, but when they run out of supplies, the mission quickly takes a drastic turn.

programme.title: Ride in the Whirlwind
programme.desc: When three ranch hands stumble across a dead man and the bandits that killed him, they are framed for murder and hunted by the sheriff.

programme.title: Rio Diablo
programme.desc: In the Old West, a bounty hunter with an unsavory past joins a groom on the trail of a gang of murdering bank robbers who have kidnapped his bride.

programme.title: Station West
programme.desc: In 1881, former Army Lt. John Haven (Dick Powell) acts as a secret government agent on a covert mission to investigate the theft of numerous gold shipments. Haven confides his mission to Capt. George Ilse (Tom Powers), who is doubtful over the shifty Haven's intent. Haven agrees to report his results to reliable gold mine owner Mary Caslon (Agnes Moorehead), then searches for the town's financier, Charlie (Jane Greer), whose nefarious dealings immediately bring her under suspicion.

programme.title: Roughshod
programme.desc: Rancher Clay (Robert Sterling) and his brother, Steve (Claude Jarman Jr.), head out across the Sonora mountain pass, followed by Lednov (John Ireland), an ex-con seeking revenge on Clay for putting him behind bars. Clay and Steve unexpectedly cross paths with a group of dance hall girls -- including Mary (Gloria Grahame), Marcia (Martha Hyer) and Helen (Myrna Dell) -- whose stagecoach has broken down, and help them get to the nearest ranch, where Lednov unfortunately catches up to Clay.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Sid Fallon tries to blackmail former gambler Julia Andueza into allowing him to use her boarding house as a gambling hall and saloon.

programme.title: The Rifleman

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas welcomes his old friend Tom Birch, who once saved his life, unaware that the man is now a bank robber on the run with his gang.

programme.desc: A woman hires Josh to clear her father on a false murder charge in a town that is not very welcoming.

programme.desc: Josh is hired to chase a killer by his brother, who is about to hang for a crime his brother committed.

programme.desc: Josh and Jason are on the trail of a karate expert accused of killing his employer.

programme.desc: Randall learns "hate comes high" in a town who have hired killers to murder their fellow resident.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh captures a wanted recruit and returns him to the Army, but the Captain refuses to pay.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh and Jason track a fugitive in Texas wanted for murder in Arizona, but his wife claims he is innocent.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A dying man offers Josh $2000 to find his son, who ran away 15 years ago.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is summoned for help when the Pinto bank is robbed.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh expects a bounty for bringing in Daniel Trenner but his prisoner is stolen by the sheriff. Ex-army personnel want to stage an illegal trial accusing their former lieutenant of dereliction of duty

programme.desc: Josh is hired by a woman to sober up Harry, a drunk who is also Josh's friend. She learned his wealthy brother who Harry hasn't seen in years is coming to visit so she wants Harry to be presentable.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh and the beautiful prisoner he is transporting are on a three day trip while her partner is still on the loose. For once Josh may not follow through on obeying the law as they fall in love.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is on his way to River City to transport three convicts there to be hanged. The dangerous prisoners escape and appoint themselves the law, after the town is hit by a tornado, killing the sheriff.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A journalist accompanies Josh on his manhunt to get an exclusive story on a bounty hunter. Josh agrees to let him join him in the hunt for Jack Torrance but finds they have different methods.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh feels compelled to repay a debt to an old friend who's in jail and may hang. However, the friend escapes, forcing Josh to go on the hunt for him until it appears he died when he went over a cliff

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: A woman asks Josh, an old friend, to help find her husband Frank - a bounty hunter out to settle a score. He wants to catch a young outlaw who shot him in the leg.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: When a convicted killer escapes prison, Josh is hired to protect the woman whose testimony put him there. The woman's husband is a lawyer who says he has always been a coward and never carries a gun.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh rides into a town looking for a man who wants to hire him. When he goes to the man's room at the hotel, Josh is shot. He must figure out who shot him but the sheriff is ordering him out of town.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is hired by Harry Weaver to track down his twin brother Pete, a wanted man. Harry is tired of being used by Pete, plus the law and bounty hunters are apt to mistake him for Pete.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh is called in to track down a new outlaw, the local sheriff who is a friend. The good sheriff who was seduced into robbing a bank by his girlfriend, convinces Josh to let him assist in her capture

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive
programme.desc: Josh escorts a photographer to take a picture of his friend El Gato, who is a hilarious bandit living in the hills of Mexico with a small army. However, El Gato is new to photographs and leery.

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: Wanted: Dead or Alive

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The death of a beloved teacher from Dan and Jackie's high school brings old classmates together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene and Ben get into a fight and ignore Becky's boundaries in the house; Dan accuses Jackie of losing all of their home videos.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene has issues with Dan's plumbing work in her new house; Jackie tries to find a caregiver for Bev.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene continues her search for a new job; Becky is desperate to spend more time with Beverly Rose.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris makes a big announcement; Ben is overwhelmed with family responsibilities.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris takes her anger out on Darlene; Dan and Louise spend an entire day in bed together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark fights for a spot in the Lanford High chamber orchestra; Jackie puts a lottery machine in the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan and Jackie take a road trip to a hardware wholesaler in Oklahoma; Darlene heads out of town and leaves behind a plethora of to-do notes for Becky and Ben.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Louise gets into a feud with Becky after accidentally sending a rude message in the family text thread.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene figures out a plan to afford Mark's college tuition; Jackie and Louise try to help Becky meet a guy.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Neville confronts Jackie about loaning Dan money; Darlene attempts to play matchmaker for Mark.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Mark's graduation approaches, he considers his relationship with his father; Louise plans a big graduation ceremony at the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A sudden turn of events forces the Conners to face their daily struggles in a way they never have before.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene is in for one surprise after another when David introduces his girlfriend, Blue (Juliette Lewis), and mentions that Mark and Harris will be spending the weekend with them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Halloween, the favorite time of year for the Conners, but an email from the school banning certain costumes, including Mark's, sets off an argument between Dan and Darlene.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: A Miracle on Christmas Lake
programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Maldon, Essex and The White Horse Inn, where hospitality expert Jayne and her husband, Pete Kocinoga, hope their attention to detail will win over their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Barnfield B&B in St Osyth, Essex, run by Christine and her toy boy husband Paul Harman. Here, as well as offering rooms, Christine also runs spiritual retreats.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit the group head to The Black Swan Inn in Pickering, Yorkshire, where Phil and Jill have spent large sums to bring their 18th century inn up to their exacting standards.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Delamere Farm in Northborough, where owner Agi Chapman, who is joined by Jayne Thorpe Godman, prides herself on providing a luxurious sleep to all her visitors.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Harrogate where management team Chris `Clarky' Clarke and Katie Light help run the White Hart Hotel. The guests meet some llamas and the extra charge for fancy coffee causes a stir.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to New Promenade Hotel in Blackpool, owned by Raouf, who is joined by friend Chrissie. There's a teetering toilet seat and Clarky and Katie find muck on the taps.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Vicky's small terraced house, aptly named The Terrace, in Oxford. On inspection, two pairs of guests discover an array of filthy finds, including a pre-sucked sweet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Robin and Liza's Georgian mansion Tall John's House in the Brecon Beacons. At dinner the guests gush over their new friendships but Vicky doesn't share their feelings.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Hillcroft in Torquay, where husband and wife team Martyn and Elaine Flint hope their lovingly decorated adults-only B&B will prove a hit with their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit sees Sam and Henry confident that their five-star rooms above a quintessential English country pub, The Bear and Swan, in Chew Magna, Somerset, will impress their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Guesthouse East in Eastbourne, where childhood sweethearts Tony and Lisa hope their guests will fall head over heels for their family friendly B&B.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Shirley B&B in Bournemouth, where Jorge Mesquita hopes to impress his guests with his all-round cleanliness and the power of his showers.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Kicking off the competition in Anglesey are newbie owners Neil and Lavinia Walker who run Castellor B&B, where it's all about going the extra mile. But the in-room extras fail to impress.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Marlow Lodge in Blackpool, where owner Deano Whiting prides himself on delivering the fun factor.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Third to host this week is manager James Hall and owner's son Adam Neale of The Black Swan in Horsham St Faith, a luxury roomed establishment with onsite restaurant and pub.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth and final visit is to Bleak House in Broadstairs, where sisters Nina and Nicola Hilton have `Great Expectations' of success and the guests are blown away by a Dickens discovery.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Torquay and owners Mark and Jo Warden hope their four-star establishment, The Cimon, has what it takes to win.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Cardinal's Hat in Worcester where owner Nigel Smith, who has more than 30 years of experience in hospitality, likes the finer things in life.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week the group head to Cledan Valley in Mid Wales, where husband and wife duo Russ and Karen Colman hope their glamping site will win over their rivals.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Springfield House in Instow, Devon, where Lucinda Renshaw, who is joined in the competition by friend Diane Passmore, transformed this home in to a B&B eight years ago.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Huddersfield, where John Whitworth hopes the unique style of The Edge Accommodation has enough personality to win over his guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Darwin Lake Holiday Village in Matlock, managed by best friends Sally McAnulty and Teresa Shirley, who take pride in their exclusive village feel.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit, the group head to Sands Resort Hotel and Spa in Newquay, where father-and-son team Nicholas and Tom Malcolm pride themselves on the vast facilities they have on offer.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Oak Tree Lane Yurt Site in Bratton Clovelly, Devon, where owner Phil Gilbert is taking things back to basics. On arrival, the guests are wowed by the Mongolian yurts.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week kicks off at Church Street Cobbles in Macclesfield, where foodie Debbie Quinn and housekeeper, cook and cleaner Isobel Reisen recently opened a B&B above a barber shop.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to rock and roll venue The Vic Bikers pub in Leicestershire where siblings John and Joy take a more laid back approach to running the business.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On day three, Steve and Verity hope the luxury touches will win over their guests at The Cranberries Hideaway in Devon.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Mehfil Hotel in Southall, London, where spiritual host Arun and his sister Rashmi hope to bring some Indian hospitality to the competition.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Helmsley North Yorkshire at Laskill Country House, where straight-talking farmer's daughter Mandy Sowray and friend Anny Harrison run a tight ship.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Swan Hotel in Telford owned by Chris Witton and his spiritual friend Rammy. They are hoping straightforward value for money will win them the competition.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&Bers head to Scalford Hall Hotel in Melton Mowbray, Leicestershire where Colin Warburg, along with student son Ben, hope their 81 room country pile will wow their rivals.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the competition this week is to The Abbey Hotel in Battle, East Sussex, run by confident young colleagues Charlie Thompson and Lauren Tucker.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Oaklea Barns Guest House in Merseyside, where Mandi Magee and partner Paul Green think their impeccable standards will wow their rivals.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Guest House Worsthorne in Lancashire, where partners Dave and Sanchia aim to win over their guests with their 300-year-old cottage turned guesthouse.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The group heads to Sleeperdorm Backpacker Hotel in Newcastle, where Ian Nicholls hopes they'll leave their designer gear at the door and bunk up in his cheap and cheerful dorms.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Parsonage Hotel and Spa in York, where Mark Toole and Natalie Allcock look to wow their guests with their country manor, complete with pub, spa and restaurant.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Truro, Cornwall, at Causilgey Manor, where former art dealers Robin and Brenda Spence want to treat their guests to a stay in the Cornish countryside.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Elmfield B&B in Devon, where retired politician Martin Perry and housekeeper Tracey Barrett pride themselves on keeping things traditional.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to The Chocolate Box in Bournemouth, where hosts Leoni Wilton and Tish Broughton want to swathe their guests in the sweet stuff.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth and final visit is to The Buckle Seaford, in East Sussex, where B&B newbies Julie and Jason Martin have set sail for seaside luxe. Can they chart a course for victory?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in Ayr, Scotland, at Blackburn Villa where Karen runs a home from home B&B helped by daughter Jade.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Gretna Green, Scotland, where Kieran and fiancée Paula of The Hazeldene are proud of the marital importance of their hotel, but suspect game playing by their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week, the B&B'ers head to Pembrokeshire, Wales, and 32 Townhouse, where Dominic Swingler and his mum Eileen hope their style and décor wows their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Greylands Guest House, in Powys Wales, where Lynda Fry and Larnie Carter have set high standards for themselves.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In Norfolk at The Old Ram Coaching Inn, five-star trained Victoria MacDonald welcomes the guests. But there's a dusty towel rail and suspicious brown smudge in the toilet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Ye Old Crown in Edenbridge, where chef and owner Aaron Webster aims to deliver a three star service for a two star price, but Victoria is looking for payback.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Beach Lodge Hotel in Mablethorpe, hosts Michele and Cheryl aim to offer the perfect beachside break. The rooms seem to hit the spot at first, but then there's a hair-raising incident.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to The Farmer's Arms, Taunton, where Alan and Alison hope their palatial rooms will win them the competition, but Michele and Cheryl are unimpressed by the cleanliness.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to The Waverley Hotel in Callander, Scotland, owned by husband and wife Gordon and Jan Halladay, who are are shocked and surprised at some of the scores.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Greenview Guesthouse in Cumbria, owned by Tanya Briggs, with help from best friend Vicky Hope. There's some fishy business and one guest goes green at the gills.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the lavish Hotel Sheraton in Blackpool, run by mum and son Liz and Ollie Brown, and where Rory discovers his own personal illuminations in the bathroom.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth and final visit is to Chapter Two Accommodation in Malton, where Katharine and Rory offer proper Yorkshire hospitality and a belly busting offering at breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off in north Norfolk at The Hero, run by best mates Harry and Rowan, who both quit university to follow their dream of becoming hospitality entrepreneurs.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Cleasewood Guest House in Great Yarmouth, Norfolk, a labour of love for rookie B&B owners Debbie and Arthur Callaghan.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the B&Bers head to Peel Hey on the Wirral, where boss Helen Holmes and assistant Suzanne hope their seven decades of experience will give them the edge.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Four Saints Brig Y Don in Llandudno, where Egyptian-born owner Shoukry, with best friend Waguih, believes his `international standard' hotel will scoop him the prize.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This week's competition kicks off in Lynton, Devon at The Seawood Hotel, managed by couple Martin and Kyle Fletcher, who hope to win over their guests with their high standards.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Gooseford Farm B&B in Dartmoor, Devon, managed by Mary Courtier and husband Julian. The farmhouse impresses but Jean and Dec are left counting the cost.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week, the group heads to Trevarrian Lodge in Newquay Cornwall, where Jean and her pro-chef husband, Dec Hegarty are hoping the food will win their guests over.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Rivendell Outdoor Club, a clothing-optional resort in Wimborne, Dorset, managed by Kerry Murphy and Andy Gautry. However, not everyone is keen to let it all hang out.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This week's competition starts in Barmouth, north Wales, at the Bae Abermaw Hotel, run by newly engaged couple Rosie Lewis and Dexter Green. On arrival, guest Tracy finds herself in a hairy situation.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Rigsby's Guest House in Doncaster, South Yorkshire, run by Tracy Ward. The lack of en-suite bathrooms causes a stink, and some guests cannot figure out the pricing.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Somerset Arms in Semington, Wiltshire, where John Adams is joined by friend Dennis Gowie. But cleanliness issues and thin walls gave cause for concern.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Cross Keys Hotel, Saffron Walden, Essex run by former flight attendant Nici Van Valen. The guests love the luxury but a mark on Tracy's towel leaves a stain on her stay and tensions are at boiling point.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: First up, Jon and Lisa welcome their rivals to the Swan Motel in Norfolk, but some of their guests find a surprise in their drawers. Later, Jon shows off his magical hosting skills on a boat tour.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Michael and Scott welcome their rivals to the Hare and Hounds in Essex. They take their guests clay pigeon shooting, but Jon and Lisa find it hard to forget the feedback that their hosts gave them the day before.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Sir Ben Slade welcomes his rivals to the 13th-century Maunsel House in Somerset, but the extra charge for a hot breakfast leaves some guests with a bad taste in their mouths. Meanwhile, Jon and Lisa turn detective to uncover Ben's past.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Gary and Linda Kellaway welcome their rivals to Lower Keats Glamping in Devon. At dinner, Jon turns joker, but Michael and Scott have a big revelation, which is no laughing matter.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Four more sets of bed and breakfast owners compete, kicking off in Tyne and Wear at Tynemouth 61, owned by hospitality veteran Stephen Minns, who grew up believing he was born with blue blood.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Black Horse Inn in North Yorkshire, where unlikely double act manager Steve Barker and side-kick and bar manager Callum Dixon believe they can win their guests over.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week, the group head to The Shores Hotel in Blackpool, where bed and breakfast beginner Enid Hall prides herself in offering clean rooms at bargain prices. However, the guests are not as impressed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Hilltop Hideaways in Leamington Spa, Warwickshire, where cousins in law Lottie and Lil Ellis are on a mission to put the glamorous in glamping.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This competition kicks off in Runswick Bay, Yorkshire and The Cliffemount Hotel, with general manager Garry Healey and housekeeper Zara Doherty. They hope the views be enough to wow the guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Next up is the Quayside Hotel in Boston, Lincolnshire, run by Alistair and partner Lana, where most of the guests are bowled over by the bling, but Claire feels stuck in a neon nightmare.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Hollington Park Glamping near Newbury, run by couple Claire and Adam. Daniele and Chantal are happy glampers, but the other guests are shocked by their surroundings.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Swan House in Kelvedon, Essex, where owner Daniele is joined by sister Chantal. On arrival, the traditional décor impresses, but Lana is left with wardrobe woes.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Holland Hall Hotel in Upholland, Lancashire run by colleagues Genice Hall and Cathy Hudson. There's a battle of the breakfasts, and feedback that cuts deep.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's first programme is Ruby Tates in Brighton, owned and run by ex-actor and failed Hollywood wannabe ALLAN LOVE. Situated in an affluent and trendy area just one street back from the beach, it's an oyster bar and seafood restaurant but Allan's never tasted the food because he hates fish.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's programme is The Priory, a 100-seater carvery in Haywards Heath, Sussex owned by ex IT consultant Scott. The former chapel of a nineteenth-century convent, the restaurant is in a spectacularly beautiful location and offers bargain roast dinners from a carvery that's been running for twenty years. Scott bought the place for £300k but with an ageing clientele eating for half-price, he's losing £5,000 a week.

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: S01:E03 - Episode 3

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: S02:E01 - Vietnam

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's second programme is Piccolo Teatro, a bijou vegetarian restaurant in Paris run by feisty Scot Rachel. A former waitress at the restaurant, Rachel bought it three years ago and now, along with best friend Stephanie, she's trying to convert the carnivorous French into a nation of veggies. For Gordon it's a sentimental journey to the city where he spent his formative years as a chef, a food mecca full of gastronomic delights that should be a dream.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's penultimate programme is The Curry Lounge in Nottingham, the city with more restaurants per square mile than any other in Britain. This 120-seater Indian restaurant has been run since January by ex sales director Raz who's new to the business - and it shows. Despite a ~500k refurbishment and décor like a Bollywood set the honeymoon period's well and truly over. His once-healthy trade is evaporating and at his current rate of loss it's uncertain he'll make it past Christmas.

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S05:E11 - Episode 11

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's final programme is The Granary in rural Hampshire, an upmarket restaurant which - at 200 seats - is the biggest Gordon's ever taken on. Originally opened by entrepreneur Nigel Nieddu as an up-market dining club four years ago, the restaurant was relaunched after a ~2m refit, but it's still losing ~4k a week. It promises classy modern British cuisine but in reality the fussy menu features food sourced from all over the globe and the locals, disconcerted by its exclusive reputation, are staying far away. Head Chef Martin doubles as parole officer to his unruly teenage charges in the kitchen, while Nigel stubbornly struggles to contain the front-of-house chaos that he's created.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's programme is The Fish & Anchor, a restaurant and bar near Lampeter in rural West Wales, owned and run by ex-boxer Mike and his wife Caron. Mike, a self-taught cook, is a one-man pressure cooker in the kitchen as he struggles to accommodate a vast menu while Caron's unique style of front-of-house management includes abusing the customers and her husband in equal measure. Every night they go twelve rounds with the local clientele who are fast deserting them to the tune of a ~£1,000 per week loss.

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: S02:E02 - Cambodia

programme.title: Gordon's Great Escape
programme.desc: S02:E03 - Malaysia

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
The venue is The Runaway Girl, a tapas bar-cum-nightclub in Sheffield city centre on the brink of collapse. The restaurant is losing money by the bucket-load and the two best friends who run it are at war with each other. The owner Justin Rowntree won't listen to reason, and his head chef and best friend Ritchie has had enough. To make matters worse the credit crunch has hit and there is fierce competition from corporate chains.
Gordon is on hand to help the friend's weather the storm with a credit crunch menu solution designed to take on the chains, but can Gordon save Justin's failing business, and prevent his friendship with Ritchie ending up in tatters?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc:
The Dovecote is a bistro in the heart of rural Devon run by a family at breaking point. The restaurant is on its last legs - they've run out of customers, money and hope. Enter Gordon, who on his first visit to the bistro is confronted with hideous wallpaper, vacuum packed lamb and a pig-headed head chef and owner who can't face up to his mistakes. Gordon has a torrid time putting them on the road to recovery, but come the autumn, they are sticking to his rules and business is looking brighter.
With the advent of the credit crunch, soaring food prices, thrifty clientele and unrelenting competition from the high street chains, Gordon is determined to galvanise the owners, the staff and the local community to ensure their survival and keep customers coming back for more.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: In the competitive finals, the remaining eight chefs must prepare their starter dish to impress the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The eight winners of the regional heats prepare to cook their fish dishes, which will be tasted and scored by the `Great British Menu' judges and veteran judge Marcus Wareing. Before they get into the kitchen, they must first learn whether they will all be cooking.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: On day three, the chosen finalists cook their main courses, which will be tasted and scored by the `Great British Menu' judges and veteran judge Tom Kerridge.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's desserts day in the finals, and the last chance for the competing chefs to impress the judges and veteran Angela Hartnett. After a hard-fought week, the end of this programme will see the judges finally reveal the winning four dishes which will make up this year's `Great British Menu'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The pressure on the chefs to deliver is immense, and even the Great British Menu judges roll up their sleeves to ensure that the banquet goes according to plan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the turn of the Scottish chefs, Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Alan Murchison, in the battle of the starters. So which dish is going to fly the flag for Scotland? Will it be cock-a-leekie terrine, pigeon salad or Scotch pie?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The Scottish chefs are all fighting for supremacy in the fish course. So who is going to come out on top? Will it be lobster cocktail cooked four ways, lobster with vegetables, or mussels and langoustine with sorrel soup and tattie scones?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the battle of the main courses, as the Scottish chefs go all out to win, with their takes on hogget Scotch pie with peas and carrots, steak and chips with a tomato relish and lamb with haggis, pearl barley and turnip puree.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the Scottish chefs Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Alan Murchison to show they've got what it takes to win. So which dessert will deliver the sweet smell of success - strawberry shortbread with whisky cream, carrot cake with cream cheese ice-cream or rhubarb and custard with ginger biscuits? And which chef will be going home early?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is judgement day and the two chefs must cook their entire menus for the Great British Menu judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only two chefs can make it through to cook for the Great British Menu judges at the end of the week and one will be going home. That decision lies with former champion Marcus Wareing, who will scrutinise their dishes every day. Today it's the starters, so which dish will he think worthy of the banquet? Will it be poached & roasted chicken with new season onions, wild rabbit and leek turnover with piccalilli, or rabbit pudding with parched peas and gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: For the fish course, which dish is going to be king: turbot with brown shrimps and spring vegetables, wild sea bass with shrimp toastie, or bream with hazelnuts and salted caramel?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course. Will the winning dish be Gloucester Old Spot pork with smoked venison, salt marsh lamb with sweetbreads, or oak roast middle white pork with broad beans?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Marcus Wareing chooses his favourite from the three dishes: caramel parfait with honey ice-cream, rhubarb and custard tart with beetroot ice-cream, and strawberries with meringue and mint water ice. For one of the chefs, this is the end of the road.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The heat is on, as only one chef can make it through to the finals and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is it going to be?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland launch their culinary assault with the starters: braised hog's head with apple sorbet, white onion soup with roasted muntjac, and rabbit and smoked bacon salad.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland are all out to impress with their fish dishes: crab in barley soup with smoked oyster, hay baked rainbow trout and beetroot cured sea trout.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland square off in the battle of the main courses. So which dish will get top marks: pigeon and rabbit with carrot terrine, lamb with purple sprouting broccoli or lamb with asparagus crown?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs from the central region to prove they've got what it takes to cook at the banquet. So which dessert will it be, heather honey custard with rhubarb, queen of puddings or lavender junket with mead jelly?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The gloves are off, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at the banquet. Who is going to come out fighting?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the chefs want the honour of cooking for the Prince and today they begin their menus with the starters: rabbit with pea mousse, ham hock with pea puree and heather smoked macon with pickled beetroot.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from the South West - Henry Herbert, John Hooker and Nathan Outlaw - are all out to impress with their fish dishes: cider-cured sea trout, poached lobster with courgette flowers and trout, crayfish and pike mousse.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs from the South West to prove they've got what it takes to cook at the banquet. So which dessert will it be: sea buckthorn curd meringue, gooseberry Queen of Puddings or lemon meringue with honey ice-cream?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This is where it gets tough, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at this year's banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out victorious?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the chefs want the honour of cooking for the Prince and today they begin their menus with the starters: a summer salad of pea mousse with pickled beetroot, ham hock with smoked cheddar mousse and chicken terrine with asparagus, onion and jasmine.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: poached lobster with confit potatoes, sea bass with brown crab, and sea trout with apple, beetroot and smoked mussels.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams pull out all the stops with their main courses: Welsh black beef with leek and potato terrine, loin and shoulder of hogget with morels, and lamb four ways with salt-baked celeriac.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their desserts: lemon verbena baked custard, mint mousse with hazelnut biscuit and beetroot parfait with chocolate and raspberry brownie.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This is where it gets tough, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at this year's banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out victorious?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be a wild rabbit with ham hock, carrots, asparagus and morels; wild rabbit with a baby leaf salad, black pudding, crispy quail's egg, broad beans and a shot of real ale; or warm pork and apple pie with chilled tomato soup, Yorkshire cheeses and homemade pickle?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: line-caught North Sea mackerel with gooseberries; pickled shellfish and wood smoked crispy prawns with the `smell of the sea'; and smoked trout soup with beetroot, cucumber and oyster nuggets.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Kenny Atkinson, Tim Bilton and Lee Bennett are determined to win but which dish will take first place? Will it be roe deer with beetroot, cauliflower and sage; venison three ways with English garden vegetables; or braised feather blade of beef and Yorkshire pudding with beer and onion gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Which dessert will earn top marks? Strawberry jelly crumble with elderflower custard; a `Best of British' dessert plate - bread and butter pudding, rhubarb and custard, curd tart and strawberries and cream; or brandy snap with cider brandy cream, basil sorbet and summer fruits?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent the North East and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the Northern Irish chefs want the honour of cooking for HRH Prince of Wales. They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be quail with asparagus, pork terrine with liver mousse, or slow-cooked pork belly with peas, morels and wild garlic? Former champion Richard Corrigan will decide.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: black sole fillet with crab; seared hand dived scallops and shellfish with seaweed butter.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs from Northern Ireland battle it out with their main courses. Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna are determined to win, but which dish will take pole position? Will it be loin of lamb, rack of lamb with slow-cooked shoulder or fillet of Shorthorn beef with bone marrow?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna deliver their desserts but which dish will earn top marks; strawberry and elderflower jelly with doughnuts and duck egg ice cream, poached rhubarb with lavender ice cream or brandy strawberry parfait with basil ice cream?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent Northern Ireland and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales, but who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the chefs want the honour of cooking for the Prince and today they begin their menus with the starters: a summer salad of pea mousse with pickled beetroot, ham hock with smoked cheddar mousse and chicken terrine with asparagus, onion and jasmine.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: poached lobster with confit potatoes, sea bass with brown crab, and sea trout with apple, beetroot and smoked mussels.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the main course and rabbit, rose veal and venison are all dished up for `Great British Menu' veteran Richard Corrigan. Plus, one of the chefs is joined by `Eastenders' star June Brown for a fundraising challenge.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course. Will a strawberry and coconut dessert, a frozen white chocolate dish or apple and cherries come out on top? `Great British Menu' veteran judge Richard Corrigan will decide who goes through to the judges tomorrow.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is decision time for the chefs from London and the South East. One chef left the competition last time and only two remain. They will cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu' judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. This time they will be joined by celebrity guest judge, comedienne and writer Arabella Weir.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is finals week and 24 of the nation's finest chefs have been whittled down to just eight. Over the course of four hour-long shows, they will battle it out in the kitchen for the chance to get a dish to the Comic Relief Banquet. Actress Patricia Hodge, one of the stars of sitcom `Miranda', joins judges Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort to taste all eight winning regional starter courses.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs cook their fish courses. They are all vying to finish in the top three and still be in with a chance of cooking at the special banquet. Tensions are high but there are still plenty of laughs as new dishes are introduced under competition rules, including a Sicilian influenced dish called the `Cod Father'. Impressionist Ronni Ancona joins the judges.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Comedian Ade Edmondson tucks into the chefs' main courses to help decide which three will remain in contention to cook at the special banquet. However, the chefs are in for a major surprise as the judges deliver unexpected news about the day's competition.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's judgement day as the chefs not only learn the top three desserts but the judges announce the winning menu. `Fast Show' writer and performer Charlie Higson helps judge the puddings. Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort decide on the four winning dishes, but there is a problem - they are torn between two dishes for one of the courses.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the climax of the competition as the winning chefs cook at the Comic Relief Banquet at the Royal Albert Hall. Special guest and co-founder of the charity Richard Curtis welcomes guests - the unsung heroes of charity work, as well as those who have benefited from their help and some of the celebrities who have inspired us to do something funny for money.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Across the country `Gardeners' World' presenters, from their own gardens and homes, give advice and share their knowledge to enable people to get the most out of their gardens. For further inspiration, professionals, horticulturists and hobby gardeners provide fellow green-fingered enthusiasts with useful tips and suggestions, no matter the size of garden or level of expertise. Whether it is creating depth in a small, backyard garden or how to make the most of the latest spinach crop with homemade pesto, presenters prove that the possibilities are endless for any gardener and garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants tender annuals for high summer colour, as well as sharing his tips for growing cherries and pruning blackcurrants. Arit Anderson discovers a paradise garden in Cambridge that has become a focal point for the local community.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam Frost demonstrates how to build a rose arch, mulches his beds and plants a blackcurrant to train up a fence. Frances Tophill visits RHS Wisley in Surrey to witness the seasonal colour that heathers can provide in the winter months.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie and the brothers go head to head to win the right to make over the garden of Christine and Tony, who were shot in a terrorist attack in Tunisia in June 2015. If ever a couple needed the peace and consoling virtues of a garden, it is this one.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie and the Rich brothers are in Northampton at the garden of Theresa and Martyn. The couple have retired and with their children moved out and providing them with grand children, they would like to enjoy a formal cottage garden.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: The team are in Aylesbury with Michelle and Alistair. They have a small back garden but they need it to work hard for them providing an entertainment and relaxation space, and somewhere to burn off steam for their two daughters, who both have autism.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: The team are in Norwich at the garden of Taj and Rachel, who have been together for nearly four years and have a puppy, and a baby on the way. They would love to challenge the designers to tackle the slope at the bottom of their garden.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Elaine in Lymington loves gardening, but her front garden is out of control, with loads of messy shrubs, an out-of-control conifer and a front door that the postman can't find. Can the team give purpose to the chaotic front space that matches Elaine's own dramatic style?

programme.title: The Autistic Gardener
programme.desc: The team are in Ealing, west London, where they've taken on a small garden with a big problem. James and Sophie's neglected plot is only eight by four metres and is on two levels with a 1 metre drop. Can the team make such a tiny garden look bigger?

programme.title: The Autistic Gardener
programme.desc: Alan and his team of autists take on their biggest garden yet of a 95-foot jungle in south London owned by Zak and Eloise. The good news for the team is that they've got £10,000 to spend on the transformation.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: For DIRT’s first trip across the pond, host Josh Rosen dove head first into Ireland. From long-held traditions to the modern-day artisanal movement, he unearthed the multicultural goldmine between the highlands and the Wild Atlantic Way—with stops for surfing, a seaweed bath, and a couple holes of golf spectated by free-range goats, of course. Foraged cocktails? Fresh crabs from Galway Bay? It’s all on the table in this episode rooted in community, homegrown ingredients, and the damn good people who bring it all together. Subscribe to our YouTube channel to catch up on all of DIRT’s past adventures.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Bearded Buck
programme.desc: The crew is loaded up and headed to Utah for an early season velvet mule deer hunt! This trip quickly becomes about more than just the trigger pull as Austin and Jerry both find themselves going after two giant mule deer that they put all of their time and energy into chasing.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoors
programme.desc: Blair is bass fishing the Butler Chain of Lakes in Central Florida.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Heroes are honored and embark on the hunt of a lifetime at the Bucks for the Brave event hosted by Record Rack and Trinity Oaks Non-Profit.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: After her first turkey, Kristy is ready for her next challenge—a buck on her own land. With her husband by her side, she experiences the thrill of her first antlered deer. Emotions run high, and this hunt is one she’ll never forget. Experience the joy of her success with her!

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Youth hunts are about learning and growing, and Tatum’s first shot doesn’t go as planned. But with the guidance of Uncle Stephen and Aunt Kristy, she stays the course and gets her buck. This is a story of patience, persistence, and pure excitement. Watch Tatum’s hunt unfold!

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Cliff draws the tag of a lifetime in Iowa, but the hunt doesn’t go as expected. Without his sick friend Stephen, and facing challenges with self-filming, Cliff contemplates giving up. But when he finally takes the biggest buck of his life, he realizes the importance of capturing the moment. Learn from his journey and see why every hunt matters!

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: For Dale, it’s not just about the big bucks. His passion lies in the hunt itself, and when it comes to taking does, he’s unstoppable. Dale’s love for the outdoors and his commitment to the craft make every hunt special. Join him as he stacks does and shows what real hunting is all about.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Graig heads to Kansas for his annual hunt, but it’s not about size—it’s about age. This big-bodied buck has seen many seasons, and Graig’s quick hunt is a tribute to the experience that comes with time in the woods. Watch this hunt and feel the thrill of outsmarting an old warrior.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Stephen has a score to settle with a Missouri buck he missed two years ago. Now, during the rut and with snow on the ground, the chase is on. The woods come alive as Stephen hones in on his target. This is the hunt he’s been waiting for—don’t miss the moment when it all comes together.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesn’t come quickly or easily.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin heads offshore, dodges storms and shows how the "Return 'Em Right" program is saving fish that experience barotrauma.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: We follow along as a decommissioned ship is sunk to create a new artificial reef, much to the delight of divers and anglers. Plus, Adapt-Able SCUBA makes underwater adventure possible for those who didn’t think it was.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Fish tacos are about as SoCal as it gets and on this visit to San Diego, Ali takes Rush fishing on a rockfish and lobster "grocery run". Slow pitch jigging and hoop netting are the techniques of choice and the rewards are delicious.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The most important fish catch is the one that got you hooked on fishing in the first place, and for many of us that catch happened early in life. On this episode Ali and Rush grab their favorite little fishing buddies for a great day on the water on their respective coasts. In Florida, Rush spends time with his son Kade fishing for huge permit while Ali takes his nephew Duke out for some wholesome yellowtail action in California.

programme.desc: Brandon Simmons take the family to the Pink Shell Resort in Ft. Meyers Beach.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons is in Duck Key where he goes freediving with Speargun maker Ed Martin and heads out deep to look for swordfish with Chris Ware

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons takes off from the Pink Shell Resort in Ft. Myers Beach to search for the mighty Redfish with Captain Nick Fischer.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon Simmons joins West Marine Advisor Eric Kufel in Sterling Alaska for an epic Kenai River fly fishing trip.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: UFC's Bryce "Thug Nasty" Mitchell heads down to Realtree Farms to hunt with Tyler Jordan and Michael Waddell. The hunt for Bryce's first turkey starts out in a gobbling frenzy, but no gobbler wants to commit to their setup. Later on, the guys hop on the carts and burn up the roads in hopes of striking a willing longbeard. The plan works and it's chaos from there. The guys get set up in seconds and the gobbler appears soon after. With a 40-plus yard shot, Mitchell has his first ever longbeard on the ground! Congrats Thug!

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Here's a look at the Realtree Road Trip crew's 2024 Franchi turkey shotgun setups. Michael Pitts and Bryan Brown get the Franchi shotguns unboxed and ready for the 2024 turkey season.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan hosts Turkeys For Tomorrow (TFT) hunt sweepstakes winner Troy Martin from Kentucky on a hunt at Realtree Farms. The morning started off good with warmer temperatures and multiple turkeys gobbling on the roost. After setting up in the hardwoods on the edge of a field, a few longbeards pitch down and come straight to the call. It results in a quick hunt on a beautiful morning. To become a member of TFT, and to support its many conservation efforts to ensure we have healthy turkeys populations in the future, click the link below.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: The Road Trips crew has been getting after it during the rut in Georgia. Tyler Jordan kills a giant buck named "Crabby" while Jackie Bushman AKA Buckmaster was in camp with us!

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan goes on a scout mission to find where a group of turkeys that have been giving him the run around, were roosting. After sneaking in and seeing a couple longbeards on a spartan camera, he had a pretty good idea where to start the next morning. It brought very little gobbling, but Jordan stayed confident, and decided to set up where the turkeys should be headed. The plan paid off and two gobblers came in to within 30 yards of his calling.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: The Realtree team meets up with Ole Miss friends Keith Carter and Ken Crain, as well as Mr. Doug from Pivotal Partners, for a Merriam's and Rio turkey hunt in northern Nebraska. The action is fast and furious. Day No. 1 brought three gobblers for team Carter/Crain. On day No. 2, the action stayed consistent and team Carter/Crain killed two more. Then, Brian Doughman from Realtree knocked down No. 6. It was another incredible hunt in the Keya Paha river valley.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: After gathering valuable information while scouting, Tyler Jordan, Chipper Jones, and Michael Pitts head out for the Nebraska whitetail opener. It isn't long before Tyler has a velvet shooter buck headed his way. You have to love it when a plan comes together.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: It's day No. 3 of the opening-week deer hunt in Nebraska, and the Road Trips Crew is on a roll. Chipper Jones continues his hunt for Mr. Perfect, Michael Pitts spots a shooter, and Bryan Brown moves stands in hopes the move will pay off.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan hunts one of the biggest bucks on Realtree Farms with his brother Colton. Colton and his Dad Bill, have seen this buck several times over the last few days not he and Tyler make a move hoping to get Colton a shot at this giant Georgia whitetail.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: Nothing beats a hunting trip with friends. The Working Class Hunter team heads to Illinois to share laughs, build bonds, and of course, chase big whitetails. It’s more than just hunting—it’s about the memories made along the way. Watch this episode and feel like part of the team!

Watch as Chef Mark Boudreaux of Hurricane Hole transforms their fresh catch into a culinary feast. Enjoy the thrill of fishing, the joy of cooking and the camaraderie of camp in The Bayou State.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: The Montana adventure continues on private lakes targeting trophy trout. This is where fish stories are born.

programme.title: Flats Class
